input_text:
Job Title: Systems Administration (NASA Program)

Location: Greenbelt, MD

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Design, Information Technology

Description:
About Peraton

Peraton is a next-generation national security company that drives missions of consequence spanning the globe and extending to the farthest reaches of the galaxy. As the world's leading mission capability integrator and transformative enterprise IT provider, we deliver trusted, highly differentiated solutions and technologies to protect our nation and allies. Peraton operates at the critical nexus between traditional and nontraditional threats across all domains: land, sea, space, air, and cyberspace. The company serves as a valued partner to essential government agencies and supports every branch of the U.S. armed forces. Each day, our employees do the can't be done by solving the most daunting challenges facing our customers. Visit peraton.com to learn how we're keeping people around the world safe and secure.

Responsibilities

Join our dynamic and diverse Peraton Technology Services Team on site, at the NASA Goddard Space Flight Center (GSFC), as a Software Engineer reporting to the IT department supporting the Environmental Test and Integration Services program. You have the unique opportunity to be engaged in exciting space projects in the GSFC state-of-the-art facilities.

Responsibilities Include:

Provide IT support for following software: Epicor, Mastercam, Polyworks, InspectionXpert, GrabCad, Ultimaker Cura, TNCremo, Vericut, Verisurf, Office 365, DAQSTANDARDDocument troubleshooting resolutions as well as New Software installations.Effectively communicate with staff to resolve IT equipment issues and escalating/communication with vendors when the situation arises.Coordinate with customer business units to provide solutions and improvements to current procedures and IT equipment used.Have an understanding of Hololens2 AR device and PolyWorks integration.Monitor and perform/assist with Security software update and patches to PCs and servers.Maintain IT inventory and coordinating procurements and excess request with staff and contractors.Assist with configuring network settings for Manufacturing and Inspection Equipment.Perform Onboarding and Offboarding of staff by setting up and/or deleting IT access to Software, File shares, and computer access.Facilitate trainings and access and well as setting up equipment in the Advanced Manufacturing Innovation Lab (3D printing)Maintain and support the AMB Conference Room, providing user support and making repairs/upgrades.Be able to support the customer Epicor operations byCoordinate and communicate with customer business units to develop and update workflow procedures for software business use.Conduct System access reviews and updating permissions and security settings for various roles of the Advanced Manufacturing Branch.Coordinate with COMTEC vendor to review system access and develop training guides for newly granted permissions and screens/operations.Assist staff members with troubleshooting issues with job entries and closures.

Qualifications

Required Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree with two or more years of experience with IT Systems Experience with Polyworks, Office 365, Mastercam software Experience Software installations Experience with working a team environment 

Desired Qualifications:

Hololens2 AR device and PolyWorks integration

Target Salary Range

SCA / Union / Intern Rate or Range

EEO

An Equal Opportunity Employer including Disability/Veteran.

Our Values

Benefits

At Peraton, our benefits are designed to help keep you at your best beyond the work you do with us daily. We're fully committed to the growth of our employees. From fully comprehensive medical plans to tuition reimbursement, tuition assistance, and fertility treatment, we are there to support you all the way.

Paid Time-Off and HolidaysRetirementLife & Disability InsuranceCareer DevelopmentTuition Assistance and Student Loan FinancingPaid Parental LeaveAdditional BenefitsMedical, Dental, & Vision Care

Experience Level (if available): None

Coordinate with customer business units for solutions and improvements
Understand Hololens2 AR device and PolyWorks integration
Monitor and perform security software updates
Maintain and support AMB Conference Room
Coordinate with customer business units for workflow procedures
Assist with troubleshooting job entries and closures
